instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.S4_PWR_EN: What is S4_PWR_EN? S4_PWR_EN turns on the S4 power rails. Signals ending in _EN enable whatever came before _EN in the signal name when the voltage of the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message:
Have this Macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no working keyboard and trackpad. board is light liquid damage.
Have tray a know good trackpad, keyboard and cable but still not working.

measurement on j4800:
Pin 19: 3,4V
Pin 14: 5,15V
Pin 10: 2,13V

<RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR> 2.09V and 0,1Ω diode mode give 0.367

Have test with a usb bluetooth mouse and that work

will test if it work when pressing down options button when startup.Nothing happens when pressing options button at startup just booting as normal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message:
No, that would fry <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR>.

Is there 3V on <RESISTOR>R8050</RESISTOR>? If not check 3V on <RESISTOR>R5294</RESISTOR> pin 1 (yes it is not on the board but test that pin)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message: So, 3V present at <RESISTOR>R8050</RESISTOR> and not at <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR>. They are on the same rail, there is your problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message: Could it bee a bad chip between this? Bade trace? Should i run a wire from <RESISTOR>R8050</RESISTOR> too <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message:
Duke: Are you sure, don't you mean <RESISTOR>R8000</RESISTOR> and not <RESISTOR>R8050</RESISTOR>?

<RESISTOR>R8050</RESISTOR> is the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4SW_SNS</SIGNAL> 
<RESISTOR>R8000</RESISTOR> is the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> Rail

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message: My guess is something wrong with <CHIP>U8000</CHIP> or <RESISTOR>R8000</RESISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message: It may also be something wrong after <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR>, if you remove it and you get 3.3V you know where to look. <CAPACITOR>C4800</CAPACITOR> or trackpad connector next.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message: Thank you XooP. will remove <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR> and check. report after

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message: There may be other places where the voltage on the rail can be pulled down, but you need to start somewhere

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> keyboard & trackpad not working light liquid damage
threads.message:
Yeah I meant <RESISTOR>R8000</RESISTOR>. 

If <SIGNAL>S4_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is present then it could be short on the bus or dead <CHIP>U8000</CHIP>.
